intro: Ericameria molesta, commonly known as yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in chaparral and coastal sage scrub habitats. It produces small, hairy leaves and has a compact, shrub-like growth habit. Ericameria molesta is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in arid conditions.
